data.text: Contents
Introduction
Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust (MSEFT) aims to be welcoming, and provide a safe environment for all staff, patients and visitors.

The Trust recognises that starting a new job can be a very stressful and anxious time. It is important both to the individual and to the organisation, that new staff become familiar with their role as soon as is practicably possible. If induction is carried out in a meaningful way there is more likelihood that an individual will enjoy and engage with their role in an effective and efficient way.

All new staff will undergo a comprehensive and structured induction programme which is tailored to meet the needs of both parties but also places the job in its organisational context so that the individual can understand and visualise how their efforts contribute to the overall objectives of the Trust.
The underlying objective of this policy is to provide guidance on the arrangements and expectations for induction within the Trust, to enable everyone to deliver a safe and efficient service.
Scope
The purpose of this document is to:
Outline the difference between Trust induction, local induction and other types of induction
Clarify who this process is applicable to
Explain how to access Trust induction, local induction and other types of induction
Clarify expectations of individuals and managers related to induction
This policy applies to everyone employed by the Trust.
This policy does not apply to agency staff. Local protocols are to be followed for agency staff, which will be reviewed for standardisation across all divisions in the Trust.
Definitions

table_items.text: The entire process of integrating new employees into MSEFT
The formal elements to be completed online prior to joining MSEFT or within their first two weeks in post
The formal, mandatory, training of clinical skills for new clinical staff
The formal process of introducing new staff to their local workplace, procedures and colleagues
Required By Law, for all employees to be provided by all employers

Mandatory training is compulsory training that is determined essential by an organisation for the safe and efficient delivery of services. This type of training is designed to reduce organisational risks and comply with local or national policies and government guidelines
Training for specific groups of people or areas set
The online system used to access various parts of induction. Also referred to by the acronym LMS, or the local name Learn.
The name of the Learning Management System at MSEFT
The team responsible for the management of Learn and queries relating to the online induction resources
Requesting training records from the individual's current NHS employer, to potentially remove the requirement for some elements of induction. Can only be requested by Recruitment.

data.text: Role and responsibilities within the Trust
Chief Executive
The Chief Executive has overall responsibility for the Health, Safety and Welfare of the employees. The implementation of the Trust induction Policy is one aspect of that management.
Chief People and Organisational Development Director

The Chief People and Organisational Development Director – is responsible for the implementation of the Policy across the organisation and will ensure that the policy is updated in line with all current and new legislation.
Recruitment Team

The Recruitment Team – are responsible for the names of all successful applicants who have accepted a post being added to the start date spreadsheet to allow them to be contacted regarding induction. Where ex-employees return to the Trust, the recruitment administrators will seek clarification from the recruiting manager on whether induction will need to be repeated. The Recruitment Managers / Advisors will ensure that the sign on process is only concluded on receipt of a completed local induction checklist signed by the employee / bank worker and the manager.
People and Organisational Development Team

The People and Organisational Development Team - are responsible for the monitoring of the policy in respect of Trust induction. The Technology Enhanced Learning (TEL) Team, within People and Organisational Development, will contact all successful applicants to provide them with access to the Trust induction and information regarding expectations and requirements. The TEL team will ensure that online modules are reviewed and updated with changes in legislation and practice. The TEL team is responsible for ensuring that the Electronic Staff Records system (ESR) is kept up to date in regards to Trust induction compliance data.
Divisional General Managers / Deputy Directors

The Divisional General Managers / Deputy Directors - are responsible for implementing all elements of the Trust induction policy within their area. They must ensure that any additional information pertaining to the local area is updated on an annual basis and is available to all permanent and temporary staff. They must ensure that new staff complete Trust induction and local induction.
Line Managers

Line Managers - are responsible for ensuring that all new staff (permanent and temporary) have completed Trust induction on commencement of their employment. Where this is not, possible, in all instances they must ensure that induction is completed within two weeks of commencement of employment. They are responsible for completing the local induction for all new permanent staff and temporary staff who are undertaking their first shift in the Trust. Managers must also complete the local induction checklist for individuals who have been transferred to their departments from other parts of the Trust. Managers must ensure that completion of local induction is recorded on Learn. Managers must retain a copy of the completed checklist in a local file, to assist in the development of the Personal Development Plan and appraisal process, as appropriate. Managers must seek the advice of the HR Team and consider disciplinary sanctions in cases where an employee fails to complete Trust and/or local induction within the timescales. No study leave should be granted until the individual has completed induction.
Newly appointed individuals

Newly appointed individuals - are responsible for completing Trust induction and local induction within two weeks of commencement. Failure to complete Trust induction makes the individual ineligible to pass their probationary period. The individual is

responsible for carrying out tasks and duties in the manner described in the Trust induction or by their manager or specialist staff at the local induction and acting safely and competently at all times. Where an individual does not feel that they are yet competent to carry out their role safely and competently they should inform their manager as soon as possible.
Individuals transferring from other wards / departments

Individuals transferring from other wards / departments - must complete the local induction checklist on reporting to the new ward / department. This must be recorded on Learn by the ward/department manager.
Temporary staff

Temporary staff - are responsible for completing induction prior to their registration on the bank. All temporary workers must complete the local induction checklist with the department / ward manager / nurse-in-charge on the first day of their first shift / placement and submit the completed local induction checklist to the Bank Office. Payment for temporary work will only be made after the completion of Trust induction and submission of the local induction checklist.
Where a temporary staff member does not feel that they are competent to carry out their designated tasks safely and competently, they should inform the department/ward manager as soon as possible.
Bank Office

Bank Office - is responsible for ensuring that payment for newly registered temporary workers is only processed on receipt of the completed local induction checklist. The Bank Office is responsible for maintaining a copy of the checklists on electronic files for bank workers and forwarding the completed checklists for updating ESR training records.
Process of Induction:
Trust Induction
Trust induction is designed to welcome new staff to Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust (MSEFT) and provide them with the base knowledge required to thrive in their workplace.
Trust induction incorporates;
Welcome to MSEFT video
Trust Welcome Event
Statutory and Mandatory eLearning
Core eLearning
Booking face to face mandatory training*
*Clinical staff do not need to book their face to face mandatory/core training as it will be provided as part of clinical induction, explained below.
A graphical representation of the full induction pathway for all staff can be found at Appendix

Trust induction is accessed via the Learning Management System, Learn. Access details will be sent to the individual via email 10-14 calendar days prior to their start date. Trust induction can be accessed as soon as the email is received, before their start date, and individuals are encouraged to start as soon as possible.
Individuals are expected to complete the elements above, excluding clinical induction, before the end of their first two weeks in post.

Inter Authority Transfers can be requested, for individuals joining from other NHS Trusts, which may influence which aspects of Trust induction require completion. The recruiting manager is to discuss this with Recruitment upon an individual accepting an offer.

If an individual has a record of essential training undertaken at recognised Education facility or a Core Skills Training Framework participant, then the qualifications are accepted as compliant and training doesn't have to be repeated.
Local Induction

Local induction is the formal process of welcoming an individual into their new workplace and ensuring they are informed of the relevant processes and procedures to keep everyone safe and able to fulfil their job role.
Local induction is applicable to all new staff, whether they be new to the Trust or moving departments internally.

The line manager should arrange for either themselves or another senior colleague within the department to meet with the new starter at the beginning of their first period of duty. In addition the line manager should arrange to spend time with the individual as soon as is practical after the start of employment.

The local induction document can be downloaded from Learn and will guide the line manager through the information to share. Please add any department/service specific information which is not detailed in the local induction document.

Local induction should be fully completed within two weeks of the new employees start date. The line manager must confirm completion of the local induction in the “My Team” area of Learn. A copy of the completed document should be kept by the individual and the line manager.
Clinical induction
Clinical staff are required to undertake clinical induction as part of their on-boarding process. This incorporates mandatory training such as manual handling and basic life support.
International nurse cohorts have a bespoke induction programme. Content includes Trust induction and clinical induction as appropriate. This is automatically booked as part of their recruitment.
Junior doctor induction
Junior Doctors joining MSEFT will be provided with access to Learn and expected to complete:
Welcome to MSEFT video
Trust Welcome Event
Statutory and Mandatory eLearning
Core eLearning
Local Induction (in the workplace)
Medical Education Teams manage/deliver the other elements of induction for Junior Doctors.
Junior Doctors joining outside of the August and October cohorts mentioned above are expected to complete:
Welcome to MSEFT video
Trust Welcome Event
Statutory and Mandatory eLearning
Core eLearning
Booking face to face mandatory training
Junior doctors are also required to complete “Junior Doctors Induction Required – SITE NAME” for their base site and any other site they may work upon.
Time in lieu
If staff complete elements of Trust induction prior to their start date, or outside of working hours, they may request time in lieu.

Managers should use their discretion to award up to 7.5 hours time in lieu, depending on how much training has been completed. This should be agreed in advance if the training takes place after the staff members start date.
International nurse cohorts, students and newly qualified nurses complete induction in working hours and therefore do not acquire time in lieu.
Staff moving department internally / returning to work after retirement
When existing staff move department internally they should complete a local induction. They do not need to repeat full Trust induction.
Staff who leave and return to the Trust should complete the local induction checklist.

If the individual has worked in the Trust within the past 12 months they are only required to complete any statutory, mandatory or core training that has expired. If it is longer than  months since they last worked in the Trust, the completion of the Trust induction is mandatory.

Temporary staff are required to undertake local induction in every department they work to ensure they are familiarised with the type of ward emergency procedures, location of emergency equipment and relevant emergency number in addition to the facilities of the ward for their comfort.
Induction reporting and non-compliance

Induction compliance is recorded in Learn, where managers will be able to view the progress of their new colleague. It is expected that managers will use this system to monitor compliance within their teams.
Compliance data will be uploaded to ESR by the Technology Enhanced Learning Team. The Technology Enhanced Learning Team are responsible for producing and distributing reports to boards/committees.
Non-compliance with Trust Induction makes the individual ineligible to pass their probationary period.
Training requirements
Managers must know how to view staff induction progress on Learn.
Support to access and use Learn is available from the Technology Enhanced Learning Team.
Monitoring and audit
Outlined below is the Trust's process of monitoring compliance with, and the effectiveness of the document's main points.

table_items.text: Aspect of compliance or effectiveness being monitored
Individual department responsible for the monitoring
Group / Committee / forum which will receive the findings/monitoring report
Committee / individual responsible for ensuring the actions are completed
On first day, then regularly within first two weeks
Trust induction compliance for temporary staff

data.text: Approval and implementation

All policies, procedures and guidelines will be approved by the Group Organisational Development Director through the risk and governance as the professional lead for Organisational Development content and strategy. These will then be forwarded to the Document control team for submission and ratification by the Joint Document Management Group.
It is the author's responsibility to inform the World Health Organisation of the approved policy documents when they are uploaded to the Trust's Intranets.
Equality impact assessment
The Trust is committed to the provision of a service that is fair, accessible and meets the needs of all individuals.
(Refer to appendix 3)
References
None.

table_items.text: ☐ A change in a service to patients
☐ A change to an existing document
☐ A change to the way staff work
What are you proposing to change?
The harmonisation of legacy Trust induction policies from all MSE sites
Why are you making this change? (What will the change achieve?)

The standardisation of Trust induction will provide reassurance that all new MSE staff are receiving the same high quality information. This will enable all staff to conduct themselves safely within their workplace and feel a sense of belonging within MSE.
Who benefits from this change and how?
Everyone benefits from clear, easy to access information via Trust induction.
Is anyone likely to suffer any negative impact as a result of this change? If no, please record reasons here and sign and date this assessment. If yes, please complete a full EIA.
a) Will you be undertaking any consultation as part of this change?
